entry.title: Combined summary - P2share: how to turn any network (or testnet!) into a bitcoin miner
entry.summary: The P2Share model introduces a decentralized mining network that operates alongside the Bitcoin mainnet, allowing miners and non-miners to engage in symbiotic relationships through sub-networks known as sharechains. These sharechains function as valid mining pools from Bitcoin's perspective, enhancing the mainnet's security without necessitating any modifications to Bitcoin itself. The core mechanism underpinning sharechains involves creating a separate blockchain where miners collectively contribute to mining Bitcoin blocks by submitting low-difficulty shares. These shares adjust their difficulty independently and incorporate the hash of the sharechain blockheader within the mainchain block template. A distinctive feature of the P2Share network is its reward distribution system, which diverges from traditional pro-rata methods by selecting a single shareholder pseudorandomly to receive the entire Bitcoin reward. This selection process scales with the amount of shares owned, aiming to achieve fairness over time as every share retains an ongoing chance for reward regardless of the network's scale. To maintain incentive compatibility, the share issuance per block is directly tied to the contributed work, calculated as \(S = c \times D_{\text{sharechain}}\), ensuring proportional fairness across all historical work. This model mirrors the Pay-Per-Last-N-Shares (PPLNS) approach in expectation, facilitating rational participation by aligning miners' share holdings with their hash rate contributions. Nodes within the sharechain set and enforce consensus, requiring a fully validating sharechain node to also be a fully validating Bitcoin node. This structure promotes trustless decentralization, mitigating custodial risks associated with centralized pools and incentivizing the holding of shares as a form of "equity" in future earnings. Shareholders thus hold a probabilistic claim on the future Bitcoin earnings of the sharechain, akin to equity in a startup but with the transparency and borderlessness afforded by blockchain technology. The integration of sharechains into the Bitcoin ecosystem offers multiple benefits, serving as experimental grounds for new features and consensus changes that can inform and coordinate with the mainnet without direct implementation. Sharechain innovations could lead to mergers, absorbing features and value while maintaining alignment with Bitcoin's conservative core. The model also presents a game-theoretic deterrent against attacks, as attempts to compromise a sharechain would entail costs without guaranteeing rewards due to the probabilistic nature of share issuance and reward distribution. In summary, P2Share represents a novel approach to decentralizing mining, channeling experimental efforts back into Bitcoin and converting potentially wasted proof-of-work into additional security for the mainnet. This framework encourages innovation within the Bitcoin ecosystem, empowering participants to explore new possibilities without compromising the network's foundational principles or security.
